gfal_testget.c

This exemple show how to convert a surl to a turl ex : use case with SRM plugin : ./gfal_testget srm://grid05.lal.in2p3.fr:8446/dpm/lal.in2p3.fr/home/dteam/test_darkvador

00001 
00006 #include <stdio.h>
00007 #include <stdlib.h>
00008 #include <unistd.h>
00009 #include <string.h>
00010 #include <sys/types.h>
00011 #include <errno.h>
00012 #include <sys/param.h>
00013 
00014 #define DEFPOLLINT 10
00015 #define TURL_MAX_SIZE 1024
00016 
00017 
00018 #ifndef _GFAL_1_X
00019 
00020 #include <gfal_api.h>
00021 
00022  // NORMAL NEW WAY TO USE IN GFAL 2.0
00023 
00024 int main(int argc,char **argv)
00025 {
00026         int errsz = 500;
00027         char err[errsz];
00028 
00029         char turl_buff[TURL_MAX_SIZE];
00030 
00031         if (argc < 2){
00032                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s SURLs\n", argv[0]);
00033                 exit (1);
00034         }
00035         gfal_set_verbose (GFAL_VERBOSE_VERBOSE);
00036         
00037         ssize_t res = gfal_getxattr(argv[1], "srm.turl", turl_buff,TURL_MAX_SIZE );
00038         
00039         if (res > 0)
00040                 printf("SURL %s Ready - TURL: %s\n", argv[1], turl_buff);
00041         else {
00042                 printf("SURL %s Failed:\n%s\n", argv[1]);
00043                 perror(" gfal_getxattr");
00044         }
00045                 
00046         return((res>0)?0:-1);
00047 }
00048 
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 
00052 /*  This is the OLD WAY GFAL 1.0 to do IT, DONT USE IT WITH GFAL2.0, IT IS FOR A  EXAMPLE OF MIGRATION 1.X to 2.0
00053 #ifdef _GFAL_1_X 
00054 #define gfal_handle_free(x) gfal_internal_free(x)
00055 
00056 
00057 #include <gfal_api.h>
00058 
00059 main(argc, argv)
00060 int argc;
00061 char **argv;
00062 {
00063         gfal_request req = NULL;
00064         gfal_internal gobj = NULL;
00065         gfal_filestatus *filestatuses = NULL;
00066         int sav_errno = 0, n = 0, i = 0, nberrors = 0;
00067         static char *protos[] = {"rfio", "dcap", "gsiftp"};
00068 
00069         if (argc < 2) {
00070                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s SURLs\n", argv[0]);
00071                 exit (1);
00072         }
00073 
00074         gfal_set_verbose (0);
00075 
00076         if ((req = gfal_request_new ()) == NULL)
00077                 exit (1);
00078         req->nbfiles = argc - 1;
00079         req->surls = argv + 1;
00080         req->protocols = protos;
00081 
00082         if (gfal_init (req, &gobj, NULL, 0) < 0) {
00083                 sav_errno = errno;
00084                 free (req);
00085                 errno = sav_errno;
00086                 perror (argv[0]);
00087                 exit (1);
00088         }
00089         free (req);
00090 
00091         if (gfal_turlsfromsurls (gobj, NULL, 0) < 0) {
00092                 sav_errno = errno;
00093                 gfal_internal_free (gobj);
00094                 errno = sav_errno;
00095                 perror (argv[0]);
00096                 exit (1);
00097         }
00098 
00099         if ((n = gfal_get_results (gobj, &filestatuses)) < 0) {
00100                 sav_errno = errno;
00101                 gfal_internal_free (gobj);
00102                 errno = sav_errno;
00103                 perror (argv[0]);
00104                 exit (1);
00105         }
00106 
00107         if (filestatuses == NULL) {
00108                 fprintf (stderr, "%s: Internal error (memory corruption?)\n", argv[0]);
00109                 exit (1);
00110         }
00111 
00112         for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00113                 if (filestatuses[i].status == 0)
00114                         printf("SURL %s Ready - TURL: %s\n", filestatuses[i].surl, filestatuses[i].turl);
00115                 else {
00116                         ++nberrors;
00117                         if (filestatuses[i].explanation)
00118                                 printf("SURL %s Failed:\n%s\n", filestatuses[i].surl, filestatuses[i].explanation);
00119                         else
00120                                 printf("SURL %s Failed:\n%s\n", filestatuses[i].surl, strerror (filestatuses[i].status));
00121                 }
00122         }
00123 
00124         gfal_internal_free (gobj);
00125         exit (nberrors > 0 ? 1 : 0);
00126 }
00127 #endif
00128 */
